tool_description: Creates detailed installation sequence and timeline for fire suppression system components, coordinating with other building systems and trades.

system_components.description: List of system components to be installed

weather_dependent.description: Whether installation is affected by weather conditions

permit_dependencies.description: Permits required before starting each phase

material_lead_times.description: Lead times for critical materials in days

error_messages: Empty components list: At least 3 system components must be specified.
Invalid building phase: Must be new construction, renovation, or retrofit.
Invalid project start date: Must be a valid future date in ISO 8601 format.
Invalid crew size: Must be between 1 and 20 workers.
Invalid work hours: Must be between 4 and 12 hours per day.
Invalid lead times: All lead times must be positive integers between 0 and 365 days.
usage: Provide the list of system components, building phase, and project start date. Optionally specify crew size, daily work hours, parallel trades, weather dependency, permit requirements, and material lead times. The tool will create a detailed installation sequence and timeline.

critical_path.description: Critical path activities that determine project duration

estimated_duration.description: Total estimated installation time in days

resource_schedule.description: Schedule of resource allocation by phase

sequence_summary.description: Summary of installation sequence and key considerations
